name: Cajun Shrimp and Sausage Skewers
description: These cute skewers are packed with juicy sausage and shrimp with homemade cajun seasoning. And the flavors are AH-MAZING!
recipeIngredient: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper (to taste)
1  12.8-ounce package smoked andouille sausage, thinly sliced

recipeInstructions.text: To make the Sriracha cream sauce, whisk together mayonnaise, Sriracha and condensed milk in a small bowl; set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: To make the Sriracha cream sauce, whisk together mayonnaise, Sriracha and condensed milk in a small bowl; set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, combine shrimp, olive oil, paprika, cayenne pepper, garlic and onion powder, oregano and thyme; season with salt and pepper, to taste. Cover, and refrigerate, turning occasionally, for at least 30 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, combine shrimp, olive oil, paprika, cayenne pepper, garlic and onion powder, oregano and thyme; season with salt and pepper, to taste. Cover, and refrigerate, turning occasionally, for at least 30 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Thread shrimp and sausage onto 4-inch-long skewers or toothpicks.
recipeInstructions.name: Thread shrimp and sausage onto 4-inch-long skewers or toothpicks.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a grill pan over medium high heat. Add shrimp in a single layer and grill until shrimp are opaque and sausage is slightly softened, about 3 minutes per side.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a grill pan over medium high heat. Add shrimp in a single layer and grill until shrimp are opaque and sausage is slightly softened, about 3 minutes per side.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately with Sriracha cream sauce, garnished with chives, if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve immediately with Sriracha cream sauce, garnished with chives, if desired.

review.reviewBody: Made this tonight for a party, and it was the first appetizer to go! Everyone was asking for the recipe. I used local sausage I purchased in Texas, but didn’t change anything else in the recipe. Such a hit! And I cooked for a bunch of Southerners!
